introduction.global_impact: 6% of global GHG emissions come from food losses and waste.
introduction.singapore_context: Every year, Singapore generates ~800 million kg of food waste. That is equivalent to the weight of more than 55,000 double-decker buses (NEA)
introduction.hierarchy: The preferred method to manage food waste is to avoid generating it. When this is not possible, excess food should be re-distributed or repurposed. Lastly, food waste should be segregated for recycling and treatment according to the Food Recovery Hierarchy developed by the USEPA.

solutions.title: Divert unsold food from Waste
solutions.description: Implement last-minute deals to avoid waste, partner with one of the existing app if necessary (refer to the suppliers list below).

solutions.title: Donate surplus food
solutions.description: Donate excess food to associations or individuals.
solutions.framework: The United States Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) created the Food Recovery Hierarchy to prioritize actions towards prevention and diversion of wasted food.

solutions.title: Track food waste
solutions.description: Monitor your food waste by implementing a food waste tracking system/ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning). It can help you to keep track of your actual waste, follow your actual consumption and therefore decrease stocks & waste.
solutions.professional_help: You may hire a professional to help you on the implementation and tracking of food waste.

solutions.title: Donate food waste to feed animals
solutions.description: Divert food scraps/ waste to feed animals in local farms.
solutions.innovative_approach: Did you know some farms are specialised in insects, such as the black soldier flies? They can turn food waste into biomaterials.

solutions.title: Convert food waste to industrial usage
applications: Used cooking oil can be recycled into biofuel
Dedicate food waste (okara and soy bean waste) to higher value products
Coffee grounds are 100% natural and have various practical usage related to gardening, cleaning, scrubbing or technological usage such as fire retardant material
solutions.coffee_composting: If you want to compost coffee grounds by yourself, be aware that used coffee grounds must be detoxified by composting for a minimum of 98 days for plants to benefit from the potassium and nitrogen contained in the roasted beans.

solutions.title: Install a food waste treatment system
solutions.regulation: Under the Resource Sustainability Act, several mandatory provisions have been adopted regarding food waste segregation and treatment in Singapore.

requirements.from_2021: Developers of new commercial and industrial premises must set aside space for on-site or off-site food waste treatment systems in their design plans.
requirements.from_2024: All existing large commercial and industrial food waste generators will be required to segregate food waste for treatment using on-site food waste treatment systems (compost) or off-site facility treatment. This includes large hotels and malls, large industrial developments housing food manufacturers, food caterers and food storage warehouses.
